conclusion: Determine the minimum safe distance between the motorcycle and the car to prevent collision during braking.
Velocity-time graph of the motorcycle shows initial velocity of 4 m/s, final velocity of 0 m/s, and time taken to stop is 8 s.
Calculate deceleration of motorcycle: a_1 = (0 - 4) / 8 = -0.5 m/s^2.
Velocity of the car as a function of time is v_2 = 3 - 0.25t.
Initial velocity of the car is v_2i = 3 m/s.
Calculate deceleration of car: a_2 = dv_2/dt = -0.25 m/s^2.
Position of motorcycle as a function of time: x_1(t) = 4t - 0.25t^2.
Position of car as a function of time: x_2(t) = 3t - 0.125t^2.
Car stops at t = 12 s, later than motorcycle, so consider time up to t = 8 s.
Position of motorcycle at t = 8 s: x_1(8) = 16 m.
Position of car at t = 8 s: x_2(8) = 16 m.
At t = 8 s, both vehicles are at the same position, so minimum safe distance must be initial distance plus any additional distance.
